title: Clube Recreativo e Atlético Catalano
text:
Clube Recreativo e Atlético Catalano, also known as CRAC, are a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> team from <a href="Catal%C3%A3o">Catalão</a>, <a href="Goi%C3%A1s">Goiás</a>. They play the third level national league <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Campeonato Brasileiro Série C</a>.
History.
Clube Recreativo e Atlético Catalano were founded on July 13, 1931. The club won their first title, which was the <a href="Campeonato%20Goiano">Campeonato Goiano</a>, in 1967, winning the competition for a second time in 2004. The club competed for the first time in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> in 2004, when they were eliminated in the third stage of the competition by <a href="Americano%20Futebol%20Clube">Americano</a>. CRAC competed in the <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a> in <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil%202005">2005</a>, when they were eliminated in the first stage by <a href="Guarani%20Futebol%20Clube">Guarani</a>. The club competed again in the Série C in <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C%202007">2007</a>, finishing that year in the fifth place in the final stage. CRAC competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20D">Série D</a> in <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20D%202009">2009</a> and the club were promoted to the Série C after finishing as runners-up for the 2012 season.
Colors and badge.
The club's color is sky blue. The CRAC badge has two stars, representing the two <a href="Campeonato%20Goiano">Campeonato Goiano</a> titles won by the club in 1967 and in 2004.
Stadium.
CRAC play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Genervino%20da%20Fonseca">Estádio Genervino da Fonseca</a>. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 12,000 people.
Current squad.
As of November 2021
